item.title: C#: IEnumerable, yield return, and lazy evaluation
item.description: Let’s talk about one of my favorite .NET features. IEnumerable is an interface for iterating over a collection. In other words, if something is an IEnumerable, you can mostly think of it like an Array or a List. You can use a foreach statement to loop through it, you can use LINQ to map or reduce it in a hundred different ways, or you can explicitly cast it to an array with .
